website_summaries.verdict: This highly reflective jacket may look like a windbreaker, but it keeps you comfortable at night with two warm layers.
pros: Reflective material, not coating, so the shine won't wear off
Full zip all the way up the hood
No ventilation, so you stay warm

customer_reviews.title: Awesome reflective jacket, but arms too tight
customer_reviews.text: Jacket is amazing for night riding because it shines super bright! My wife took 2 photos of me. In the first one, she used her camera flash (my back towards the camera), and in the second photo (me facing forward), she had the flash off and used a flashlight pointed at the floor in front of me. 5 Stars for its super brightness! Good length for me, except the arms and chest are really tight. If you spend any time at the gym, this may be way too tight for you. Wish it was looser in the arms and chest area. -2 Stars for the fitment issue, but it's still a really good jacket for being out at night .
customer_reviews.author: DNFFTop Contributor: Kayaking

customer_reviews.title: The US size translations are correct!
customer_reviews.text: Based on reviews here I sized up to a US Large although I usually wear a Medium. It is a bit loose and long. The bottom has a drawstring so that it can be tightened up there. The side pocket openings are a bit small, there are no inside pockets, and the front zipper is not a pocket, it's just for show. That said, the fabric is very reflective and reasonably waterproof. I just wish I'd bought a Medium!
customer_reviews.author: DaveAs

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, incorrect sizing verbiage
customer_reviews.text: The Asian sizing verbiage fit closer than the suggested US sizes. Bought the "Asian M = US XS for my wife who wears XS, and she was swimming in it. I, on the other hand wear US M, find it fits snugly for me(score for me). Planning on buying an 'Asian S' for the wife with expectations to fit her.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Too small, asian sizing.
customer_reviews.text: The jacket is okay, however I ordered a 2x large and I can barely put it on. I really liked the reflectiveness so I gave it three stars. However it is too small. I am 6' and weigh about 220. I normally wear a large or extra large in a jacket. This fit like a medium, even though it was a 2X large. I am donating the jacket to the Goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Axeman

customer_reviews.title: Great price!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I was at a crosswalk last night and people in a car were taking pictures of me because I was glowing from their view 😂 This is my 2nd pair. I bought one at forever 21 for $60 last year and it didn’t even last 3 months. It started to break apart after washing.

customer_reviews.title: Very reflective, water proof but beware it is not transferable.
customer_reviews.text: For this price range, it is a great product. It does what it claims, good fitting, excellent reflection and waterproof. You might, however, consider buying a product that has some ventilation wholes or breathable membrane if you are going to use it in warmer months or when exercising/biking.

customer_reviews.title: Size is way too small!
customer_reviews.text: I read a few reviews about the product itself and most were positive except for the fit. Said to order larger size than normal, runs small. Several comments said they had fixed the sizing issue so I ordered the jacket to wear at night walking my dog. Tag says 4X but size is maybe a Youth L at best. I'm 5"11" and 175lbs and the jacket might fit my 14 year old daughter. Sending it back.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I think it is a little tight around the waist but I love it. Been waiting on some brands that reflect like this at a cheaper price. I am a woman who usually wears mediums in women sizes due to my long arms so I got a small in men. Fits well. I have to pull the jacket up because I not zip it around my waist fully. Fits enough to have a thinner jacket underneath. I wish the hood was a bit larger though. Would not protect your head well in the rain.
